@dev Add a non-owner user to whitelist

@dev Remove a non-owner user from blacklist

devdoc.author: Harsh Rajat
devdoc.details: This Contract forms File Storage / Stamping / Encryption part of Hydro Protocols

acceptFileTransfer(uint256,uint256).details: Function to accept file transfer from a user

params._atRecipientTransferIndex: is the file mapping stored no the recipient transfers mapping
params._toRecipientGroup: is the index of the group where the file is suppose to be for the recipient

acceptStamping(uint256).details: Function to accept stamping of an item by the intended recipient

params._stampingReqIndex: is the index of the item present in the Stamping Requests mapping of the recipient

addToBlacklist(uint256).details: Remove a non-owner user to blacklist

params._nonOwnerEIN: is the ein of the recipient

addToWhitelist(uint256).details: Add a non-owner user to whitelist

params._nonOwnerEIN: is the ein of the recipient

createGroup(string).details: Function to create a new Group for the user

params._groupName: describes the name of the group

deleteGroup(uint256).details: Function to delete an existing group for the user / ein

params._groupIndex: describes the associated index of the group for the user / ein

getFileIndexes(uint256,uint256,uint16,bo.details: Function to get the desired amount of files indexes (max 20 at times) of an EIN, the 0 indicates

params._asc: is the order by which the files will be presented
params._ein: is the EIN of the user
params._limit: is the limit of file indexes requested
params._seedPointer: is the seed of the order from which it should begin

getFileIndexes(uint256,uint256,uint16,bo.return: fileIndexes is the array of file indexes for the specified users

getFileInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Function to get file info of an EIN
getFileInfo(uint256,uint256).return: protocol is the protocol used for storing that file (for example: 1 is IPFS, etc, etc). Used to fetch file from JS LibraryprotocolMeta contains the additional essential infomation about the protocol if anyname is the name of the file along with the extensionhash1 is the

getFileOtherInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Function to get file info of an EIN

getFileTransferInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Function to get file tranfer info of an EIN

getFileTransferOwners(uint256,uint256,ui.details: Function to get file tranfer owner info of an EIN

getGlobalItems(uint256,uint256).details: Function to get global items info from the entire File Management System of Ice

params._index1: is the first index of item
params._index2: is the second index of item

getGlobalItems(uint256,uint256).return: ownerEIN is the EIN of the user who owns the itemitemRecord is the record of that item in relation to the individual userisFile indicates if the item is file or groupisHidden indicates if the item is hidder or visibledeleted indicates if the item is already deleted from the individual user perspectivesharedToCount is the count of sharing the item has

getGlobalItemsMapping(uint256,uint256,ui.details: Function to get info of mapping to user for a specific global item

params._index1: is the first index of global item
params._index2: is the second index of global item

getGlobalItemsMapping(uint256,uint256,ui.return: mappedToEIN is the user (EIN)atIndex is the specific index in question, only returns on shares typestimestamp is the time when the file was stamped by the EIN, only returns on stamping types

getGlobalItemsStampingInfo(uint256,uint2.details: Function to get global items stamping info from the entire File Management System of Ice

params._index1: is the first index of item
params._index2: is the second index of item

getGlobalItemsStampingInfo(uint256,uint2.return: stampingRecipient is the EIN of the recipient for whom stamping is requested / denied / completedstampingRecipientIndex is the item index mapped in the mapping of stampingsReq of that recipientstampingInitiated either returns 0 (false) or timestamp when the stamping was initiatedstampingCompleted either returns 0 (false) or timestamp when the stamping was completedstampingRejected indicates if the stamping was rejected by the recipient

getGroup(uint256,uint256).details: Function to return group info for an EIN
getGroup(uint256,uint256).return: index is the index of the groupname is the name associated with the group

getGroupFileIndexes(uint256,uint256,uint.details: Function to get all the files of an EIN associated with a group

params._asc: is the order by which the files will be presented
params._groupIndex: is the index where group is stored
params._limit: is the limit of file indexes requested
params._seedPointer: is the seed of the order from which it should begin

getGroupIndexes(uint256,uint256,uint16,b.details: Function to return group indexes used to retrieve info about group

params._asc: is the order of group indexes in Ascending or Descending order
params._limit: is the number of indexes to return, capped at 20
params._seedPointer: is the pointer (index) of the order mapping

getGroupIndexes(uint256,uint256,uint16,b.return: groupIndexes the indexes of the groups associated with the ein in the preferred order

params._index1: is the first index of item
params._index2: is the second index of item
params._isHidden: is the flag to hide that item or not

initiateFileTransfer(uint256,uint256).details: Function to intiate file transfer to another EIN(user)

params._fileIndex: is the index of file for the original user's EIN

initiateStampingOfItem(uint256,bool,uint.details: Function to initiate stamping of an item by the owner of that item

params._isFile: indicates if the item is File or Group
params._itemIndex: is the index of the item (File or Group)
params._recipientEIN: is the recipient EIN of the user who has to stamp the item

rejectFileTransfer(uint256).details: Function to revoke file transfer inititated by the current owner of that file

params._atRecipientTransferIndex: is the file mapping stored no the recipient transfers mapping

rejectStamping(uint256).details: Function to reject stamping of an item only by the recipient

params._recipientItemIndex: is the index of the item present in the Stamping Requests mapping of the recipient

removeFromBlacklist(uint256).details: Remove a non-owner user from blacklist

params._nonOwnerEIN: is the ein of the recipient

removeFromWhitelist(uint256).details: Remove a non-owner user from whitelist

params._nonOwnerEIN: is the ein of the recipient

removeShareFromEINs(uint256[],uint256,bo.details: Function to remove a shared item from the multiple user's mapping, always called by owner of the Item

params._fromEINs: are the EINs to which the item should be removed from sharing
params._isFile: indicates if the item is file or group
params._itemIndex: is the index of the item on the owner's mapping

removeSharingItemBySharee(uint256).details: Function to remove shared item by the user to whom the item is shared

params._itemIndex: is the index of the item in shares

renameGroup(uint256,string).details: Function to rename an existing Group for the user / ein

params._groupIndex: describes the associated index of the group for the user / ein
params._groupName: describes the new name of the group

revokeFileTransfer(uint256,uint256).details: Function to revoke file transfer inititated by the current owner of that file

params._fileIndex: is the index where file is stored
params._transfereeEIN: is the EIN of the user to whom the file needs to be transferred

revokeStamping(uint256,bool).details: Function to revoke stamping of an item only by the owner

params._isFile: indicates if the item is File or Group
params._ownerItemIndex: is the index of the item (File or Group) in relation to the owner of the item

shareItemToEINs(uint256[],uint256,bool).details: Function to share an item to other users, always called by owner of the Item

params._isFile: indicates if the item is file or group
params._itemIndex: is the index of the item to be shared to
params._toEINs: are the array of EINs which the item should be shared to

devdoc.title: Ice Protocol

userdoc.notice: Create Protocol Less File Storage, Grouping, Hassle free Encryption / Decryption and Stamping using Snowflake
